intro: Tephrosia polystachya var. longidens, commonly known as the long-stemmed tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in dense, branched clusters. The variety longidens is distinguished by its elongated, slender stems and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses.
